errors.error_description: The note about escaping the '#' character for channel names on a Unix command line provides an incorrect example (`/#test`). This syntax is wrong and will not work as intended in most shells.
correction_candidates: The note is incorrect; the correct syntax is to use single quotes: `'#test'`.
The correct way to escape the character is by using `^#test`.
The note should advise using a backslash escape like `\#test` or quoting the argument like `"#test"`.
The `#` character does not need to be escaped on modern Unix shells.
errors.golden_answer: The note should advise using a backslash escape like `\#test` or quoting the argument like `"#test"`.
